newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan copper shares up as copper prices rebound.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan copper shares up as copper prices rebound.

text.p: Taiwan's copper-related shares surged at mid-morning on Friday on perceptions of rebounding international copper prices, brokers said.
After 80 minutes, S&T Copper was up T$1.1 or 4.33 percent at T$26.5 and First Copper & Iron 50 cents or 2.92 percent to T$17.6.
The overall index was up only 0.12 percent.

"International copper prices have rebounded some 10 percent since September, a factor that surely will help improve local copper makers' profit prospects," said Tank Hung, an analyst at Yuan Ta Securities. "Whether the rebound will continue or not remains to be seen."
Hung said listed firms' profit performance also would be affected by each processor's copper stock as well as copper demand from downstream industries.
